This section describes the design of the hazard prediction module in the data fusion cell. This design aims to align the internal interfaces in the data fusion cell to ensure full fidelity of all related CBRN information to inform the CBRN hazard prediction. Besides, the design has to ensure that the generated CBRN picture is continuously available to the other parts of the data fusion cell to describe the most accurate information on hazards and contamination including the predicted CBRN cloud movement over time.

6.1 General description:
The hazard prediction module in the data fusion cell is designed to integrate and analyze various sources of CBRN (chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear) information to inform the prediction of potential hazards and contamination. The module will generate a comprehensive CBRN picture, including the predicted movement of CBRN clouds over time, and make this information continuously available to other parts of the data fusion cell.

6.2 Design:
The hazard prediction module will be designed with internal interfaces that ensure the full fidelity of all related CBRN information. This will involve implementing data filtering and fusion techniques to combine and integrate the various sources of CBRN information. The module will also incorporate algorithms and models to predict the movement of CBRN clouds based on meteorological data and other relevant factors.

6.3 Technical description:
The hazard prediction module will be implemented using a combination of software and hardware technologies. It will utilize specialized software tools and algorithms for data integration and analysis, as well as hardware components such as sensors and monitoring systems to collect CBRN data. The module will be designed to operate in real-time, with the ability to continuously update and refine the CBRN picture as new information becomes available.

6.4 Responsibilities:
The hazard prediction module will be responsible for integrating and analyzing all relevant CBRN information, predicting the movement of CBRN clouds, and generating a comprehensive CBRN picture. It will also be responsible for making this information continuously available to other parts of the data fusion cell. The team responsible for designing and implementing the hazard prediction module will have expertise in CBRN data analysis, software development, and hardware engineering.
